text: Alfred Charles "A. J." Bowen Jr. (born December 21, 1977) is an American actor and producer. He starred in The Signal (2007)The Signal (2007): Triple Threat, review by Matt Zoller Seitz, The New York Times, 22 Feb. 2008 and A Horrible Way To Die (2010).You're Next review by Dennis Harvey, Variety (magazine) 14 Sept. 2011. "....with genre personalities, including all three leads from A Horrible Way to Die". ==Early life== Bowen was born in Marietta, Georgia, and attended the University of Georgia along with Jacob Gentry and David Bruckner. He was initially a musician. ==Career== LA Weekly called Bowen "mumblegore's go-to star". He starred in The Signal (2007) and The House of the Devil (2009).A.J. Bowen Toplines 'Rites of Spring', Early Promo Art! His production company, Normaltown, has recently completed its first feature, Maidenhead, in which he stars.New Maidenhead Trailer Serenades Us He also starred in Hatchet II (2010).A.J. Bowen and Tom Holland Join Cast of Hatchet 2 He was part of the Christmas episode of Dread Central's Dinner for Friends ("Shark Alarm 2009", the holiday edition of the site's podcast).Dinner For Fiends: Christmas with the Devils He also starred in the thriller film Rites of Spring.School's Out Forever: A Visit to the Set of Padraig Reynolds' 'Rites of Spring'! He starred in the science fiction film Synchronicity.How to Throw a “SUPER PSYCHO SWEET 16” Party (with exclusive photos) He co-starred in the film You're Next (2011) and appeared in The Reconstruction of William Zero (2014). ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
